info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 22 at 10:14AM PDT until October 22 at 1:15PM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Tulare.
* WHEN...Until 115 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Dinuba, Farmersville, Exeter and Ivanhoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
